field.doc: A burst read (reading using the auto-increment) of 4 bytes starting at address 00, returns the manufacturing ID: "K" "i" "o" "n" in ascii codes "0x4B" "0x69" "0x6F" "0x6E"
field.name: MANID

field.doc: A burst read (reading using the auto-increment) of 2 bytes starting at address 01, returns Who-Am-I value ("WAI") as the first byte (LSB) and a 2nd byte (MSB) that returns silicon specific ID.
field.name: PARTID

register.doc: ADP accelerometer output x.
register.name: XADP_L

register.doc: ADP accelerometer output y
register.name: YADP_L

register.doc: ADP accelerometer output z
register.name: ZADP_L

register.doc: Accelerometer output register x
register.name: XOUT_L

register.doc: Accelerometeroutput register y
register.name: YOUT_L

register.doc: Accelerometer output register z
register.name: ZOUT_L

register.doc: The Command Test Response (COTR) register is used to verify proper integrated circuit functionality.
register.name: COTR

field.doc: Command Test Responses
field.name: DCSTR

register.doc: This register can be used for supplier recognition
register.name: WHO_AM_I

field.doc: WAI value
field.name: WAI

register.doc: Current Tilt Position Register.
register.name: TSCP

field.doc: Left state X' negative (x-)
field.name: LE

field.doc: Right state X' positive (x+)
field.name: RI

field.doc: Down state Y' negative (y-)
field.name: DO

field.doc: Up state Y' positive (y+)
field.name: UP

field.doc: Face Down state Z negative (z-)
field.name: FD

field.doc: Face Up Z positive (z+)
field.name: FU

register.doc: Previous Tilt Position Register.
register.name: TSPP

field.doc: Left state X' negative (x-)
field.name: LE

field.doc: Right state X' positive (x+)
field.name: RI

field.doc: Down state Y' negative (y-)
field.name: DO

field.doc: Up state Y' positive (y+)
field.name: UP

field.doc: Face Down state Z negative (z-)
field.name: FD

field.doc: Face Up Z positive (z+)
field.name: FU

register.doc: This register contains the tap/double tap axis specific interrupts. Data is updated at the ODR settings determined by OTDT<2:0> in CNTL3.
register.name: INS1

field.doc: X' negative (x-)
field.name: TLE

field.doc: X' positive (x+)
field.name: TRI

field.doc: Y' negative (y-)
field.name: TDO

field.doc: Y' positive (y+)
field.name: TUP

field.doc: Z negative (z-)
field.name: TFD

field.doc: Z positive (z+)
field.name: TFU

register.doc: This register tells which function caused an interrupt.
register.name: INS2

field.doc: Free fall Status (FFS) bit. This bit is cleared when the interrupt latch release register (INT_REL) is read.
field.name: FFS

field.doc: Buffer Full Interrupt (BFI) bit indicates that buffer has been filled. This bit is automatically cleared when at least one sample from the buffer is read.
field.name: BFI

field.doc: Watermark Interrupt bit indicates that user-defined buffer’s sample threshold (watermark) has been exceeded when in FIFO or Stream modes. Not used in Trigger mode. This bit is automatically cleared when buffer is read and the content is below the watermark.
field.name: WMI

field.doc: Data Ready (DRDY) interrupt bit indicates that new acceleration data is available in output data registers 0x08 to 0x0D. This bit is cleared when acceleration data is read or the interrupt latch release register (INT_REL) is read.
field.name: DRDY

field.doc: Tap/Double-Tap Status bit. This bit is cleared when the interrupt latch release register (INT_REL) is read
field.name: TDTS

field.doc: Tilt Position Status bit
field.name: TPS

register.doc: This register reports the axis and direction of detected motion that triggered the wakeup interrupt.
register.name: INS3

field.doc: Wake up interrupt. This bit is cleared when the interrupt latch release register (INT_REL) is read. WUFS = 1 – Motion is above wake up threshold, WUFS = 0 – Motion is below wake up threshold
field.name: WUFS

field.doc: Back to sleep interrupt. This bit is cleared when the interrupt latch release register (INT_REL) is read. BTS = 1 – Motion is below back to sleep threshold, BTS = 0 – Motion is above back to sleep threshold
field.name: BTS

field.doc: X' negative (x-)
field.name: XNWU

field.doc: X' positive (x+)
field.name: XPWU

field.doc: Y' negative (y-)
field.name: YNWU

field.doc: Y' positive (y+)
field.name: YPWU

field.doc: Z negative (z-)
field.name: ZNWU

field.doc: Z positive (z+)
field.name: ZPWU

register.doc: This register reports the status of the interrupt.
register.name: STATUS_REG

field.doc: reports the combined (OR) interrupt information according to interrupt setting: 0= no interrupt event, 1= interrupt event has occurred.
field.name: INT

field.doc: reports the wake/back to sleep state; 0 = back-to-sleep state,1 = wake state.
field.name: WAKE

field.doc: Interrupt latch release. Latched interrupt source information (INS1-INS3) is cleared and physical interrupt latched pin is changed to its inactive state when this register is read. WMI, BFI and STPWMI are not cleared by this command.

register.doc: Control register 1. Read/write control register that controls the main feature set.
register.name: CNTL1

field.doc: controls the operating mode. 0= stand-by mode, 1= operating mode.
field.name: PC1

field.doc: controls the resolution of the accelerometer output. RES = 0 - low power, higher noise mode. RES = 1 - higher power, lower noise mode
field.name: RES

field.doc: enables the data ready engine. DRDYE = 0 – disable, DRDYE = 1 - enable
field.name: DRDYE

field.doc: G-range Select (GSEL) bits select the acceleration range of the accelerometer outputs. This range is also called a full-scale range of the accelerometer.
field.name: GSEL

field.doc: enables the Tap/Double tap engine. TDTE = 0 – disable, TDTE = 1 – enable
field.name: TDTE

field.doc: enables the Tilt engine.TPE = 0 – disable, TPE = 1 – enable
field.name: TPE

register.doc: Control register 2. Read/write control register that primarily controls tilt position state enabling.
register.name: CNTL2

field.doc: The Software Reset bit initiates software reset, which performs the RAM reboot routine. This bit will remain 1 until the RAM reboot routine is finished.
field.name: SRST

field.doc: The Command Test Control bit is used to verify proper ASIC functionality. COTC = 0 – no action, COTC = 1 – sets AA to COTR register, when the COTR register is read, COTC is cleared and STR = 55.
field.name: COTC

field.doc: Tilt Left state mask
field.name: LEM

field.doc: Tilt Right state mask
field.name: RIM

field.doc: Tilt Down state mask
field.name: DOM

field.doc: Tilt Up state mask
field.name: UPM

field.doc: Tilt Face Down state mask
field.name: FDM

field.doc: Tilt Face Up state mask
field.name: FUM

register.doc: Control register 3. Read/write control register that provides control of the Output Data Rate (ODR) for Tilt, Tap, and Wake-up engines.
register.name: CNTL3

field.doc: Tilt Position (OTP) sets the output data rate for the Tilt Position function
field.name: OTP

field.doc: Tap/Double-TapTM (OTDT) sets the output data rate for the Directional-Tap function
field.name: OTDT

field.doc: Wake-Up Function (OWUF) sets the output data rate
field.name: OWUF

register.doc: Control register 4. Read/write control register that provides more feature set control.
register.name: CNTL4

field.doc: defines debounce counter clear mode
field.name: C_MODE

item.doc: debounce counter is reset if accelerometer data is below threshold
item.name: RESET

item.doc: debounce counter is decremented if accelerometer data is below threshold
item.name: DECREMENTED

field.doc: defines wake / back-to-sleep threshold mode. TH_MODE = 0 – absolute threshold, TH_MODE = 1 – relative threshold
field.name: TH_MODE

field.doc: Wake-Up Function Engine enable bit
field.name: WUFE

field.doc: Back-to-Sleep Engine enable bit.
field.name: BTSE

field.doc: defines Pulse Reject mode
field.name: PR_MODE

item.doc: reject pulse-like motion only in case motion detection in positive and negative directions is enabled (XPWUE and XNWUE bits are set to 1 in INC2 register).
item.name: REJECTED

field.doc: sets the output data rate at which the back-to-sleep (motion detection) performs its function during wake state
field.name: OBTS

register.doc: Control register 5. Read/write control register that provides more feature set control. Note that to properly change the value of this register, the PC1 bit in CNTL1 must first be set to “0”.
register.name: CNTL5

field.doc: Advanced Data Path (ADP) enable. ADPE = 0 – Advanced Data Path is disabled. ADPE = 1 – Advanced Data Path is enabled. Outputs are available in XADP, YADP, ZADP registers.
field.name: ADPE

field.doc: manual wake-sleep engine overwrite.MAN_WAKE = 0 – default, MAN_WAKE = 1 – forces wake state (bit is self-cleared)
field.name: MAN_WAKE

field.doc: manual wake-sleep engine overwrite. MAN_SLEEP = 0 – default, MAN_SLEEP = 1 – forces sleep state (bit is self-cleared)
field.name: MAN_SLEEP

register.doc: Control register 6. Read/write control register that provides more feature set control.
register.name: CNTL6

field.doc: enables the I2C auto release function. I2C_ALE = 0 – disabled, I2C_ALE = 1 – enabled
field.name: I2C_ALE

item.doc: I2C auto release function is disabled
item.name: DISABLED

item.doc: I2C auto release function is enabled
item.name: ENABLED

field.doc: I2C auto release function counter select
field.name: I2C_ALC

register.doc: Output data control register that configures the acceleration outputs.
register.name: ODCNTL

field.doc: Low-Pass filter roll off control. LPRO = 0 – filter corner frequency set to ODR/9, LPRO = 1 – filter corner frequency set to ODR/2
field.name: LPRO

item.doc: IIR filter corner frequency set to ODR/9 (default)
item.name: ODR_9

item.doc: IIR filter corner frequency set to ODR/2
item.name: ODR_2

field.doc: Fast Start Up Enable bit.
field.name: FSTUP

field.doc: Acceleration Output data rate.
field.name: OSA

register.doc: Interrupt control 1. This register controls the settings for the physical interrupt pin INT1
register.name: INC1

field.doc: Pulse interrupt 1 width configuration
field.name: PW1

field.doc: enables/disables the physical interrupt pin 1. 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: IEN1

field.doc: Interrupt active level control for interrupt pin 1, 0=active low, 1=active high.
field.name: IEA1

field.doc: Interrupt latch control for interrupt pin 1, 0=latched, 1=one pulse
field.name: IEL1

field.doc: sets the polarity of Self Test. STPOL = 0 – Negative, STPOL = 1 – Positive
field.name: STPOL

field.doc: sets the 3-wire SPI interface. SPI3E = 0 – disabled, SPI3E = 1 – enabled
field.name: SPI3E

register.doc: Interrupt control 2. This register controls which axis and direction of detected motion can cause an interrupt.
register.name: INC2

field.doc: And-Or configuration. 0=Or combination of selected directions, 1=And combination of selected axes
field.name: AOI

field.doc: x negative (x-) mask for WUF, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: XNWUE

field.doc: x positive (x+) mask for WUF, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: XPWUE

field.doc: y negative (y-) mask for WUF, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: YNWUE

field.doc: y positive (y+) mask for WUF, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: YPWUE

field.doc: z negative (z-) mask for WUF, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: ZNWUE

field.doc: z positive (z+) mask for WUF, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: ZPWUE

register.doc: Interrupt control 3. This register controls which axis and direction of tap/double tap can cause an interrupt.
register.name: INC3

field.doc: x negative (x-): 0 = disabled, 1 = enabled
field.name: TLEM

field.doc: x positive (x+): 0 = disabled, 1 = enabled
field.name: TRIM

field.doc: y negative (y-): 0 = disabled, 1 = enabled
field.name: TDOM

field.doc: y positive (y+): 0 = disabled, 1 = enabled
field.name: TUPM

field.doc: z negative (z-): 0 = disabled, 1 = enabled
field.name: TFDM

field.doc: z positive (z+): 0 = disabled, 1 = enabled
field.name: TFUM

register.doc: Interrupt control 4. This register controls routing of an interrupt reporting to physical interrupt pin INT1
register.name: INC4

field.doc: Free fall interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 1, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: FFI1

field.doc: Buffer full interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 1, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: BFI1

field.doc: Watermark interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 1, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: WMI1

field.doc: Data ready interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 1, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: DRDYI1

field.doc: Back to sleep interrupt reported in interrupt pin 1
field.name: BTSI1

field.doc: Tap/Double Tap interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 1, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: TDTI1

field.doc: Wake Up (motion detect) interrupt reported pn physical interrupt pin 1, 0=disable, 1=enable (and IEN1=1).
field.name: WUFI1

field.doc: Tilt position interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 1, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: TPI1

register.doc: Interrupt control 5. This register controls the settings for the physical interrupt pin INT2.
register.name: INC5

field.doc: Pulse interrupt 2 width configuration
field.name: PW2

field.doc: enable/disable physical interrupt pin 2, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: IEN2

field.doc: Interrupt active level control for interrupt pin 2, 0=active low, 1=active high.
field.name: IEA2

field.doc: Interrupt latch control for interrupt pin 2, 0=latched, 1=one pulse
field.name: IEL2

field.doc: Latched interrupt source information(INS1-INS3) is cleared and physical interrupt-1 latched pin is changed to its inactive state at pulse interrupt-1 trailing edge. Note: WMI, BFI, and STPWMI are not auto-cleared by a pulse interrupt trailing edge. ACLR2 = 0 – disable, ACLR2 = 1 – enable
field.name: ACLR2

field.doc: Latched interrupt source information(INS1-INS3) is cleared and physical interrupt-1 latched pin is changed to its inactive state at pulse interrupt-2 trailing edge. Note: WMI, BFI, and STPWMI are not auto-cleared by a pulse interrupt trailing edge. ACLR2 = 0 – disable, ACLR2 = 1 – enable
field.name: ACLR1

register.doc: Interrupt control 6. This register controls routing of interrupt reporting to physical interrupt pin INT2
register.name: INC6

field.doc: Free fall interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin INT2. FFI2 = 0 – disable, FFI2 = 1 – enable
field.name: FFI2

field.doc: Buffer full interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin INT2. BF2 = 0 – disable, BF2 = 1 – enable
field.name: BFI2

field.doc: Watermark interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin INT2. WMI2 = 0 – disable, WMI2 = 1 – enable
field.name: WMI2

field.doc: Data ready interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin INT2. DRDYI2 = 0 – disable, DRDYI2 = 1 – enable
field.name: DRDYI2

field.doc: Back to sleep interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin INT2. BTSI2 = 0 – disable, BTSI2 = 1 – enable
field.name: BTSI2

field.doc: Tap/Double Tap interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin 2, 0=disable, 1=enable.
field.name: TDTI2

field.doc: Wake-Up (motion detect) interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin INT2. WUFI2 = 0 – disable, WUFI2 = 1 – enable
field.name: WUFI2

field.doc: Tilt position interrupt reported on physical interrupt pin INT. TPI2 = 0 – disable, TPI2 = 1 – enable
field.name: TPI2

field.doc: This register is the initial count register for the tilt position state timer
field.name: TSC

register.doc: Tap/Double Tap report control.
register.name: TDTRC

field.doc: enables/disables the double tap interrupt. DTRE = 0 – do not update INS1 or DTDS if double tap occurs, DTRE = 1 – update INS1 and DTDS in INS2 with double tap events
field.name: DTRE

field.doc: enables/disables single tap interrupt. STRE = 0 – do not update INS1 or DTDS if single tap occurs, STRE = 1 – update INS1 and DTDS in INS2 single tap events
field.name: STRE

field.doc: This register contains counter information for the detection of a double tap event.
field.name: TDTC

field.doc: The Tap Threshold High (TTH) register represents the 8-bit jerk high threshold to determine if a tap is detected
field.name: TTH

field.doc: The Tap Threshold Low (TTL) register represents the 8-bit (0-255) jerk low threshold to determine if a tap is detected.
field.name: TTL

register.doc: This register contains counter information for the detection of any tap event
register.name: FTD

field.doc: Detection tap for the high limit
field.name: FTDH

field.doc: Detection tap for the low limit
field.name: FTDL

field.doc: This register contains counter information for the detection of a double tap event
field.name: STD

field.doc: This register contains counter information for the detection of a tap event
field.name: TLT

field.doc: This register contains counter information for the detection of single and double taps.
field.name: TWS

field.doc: Freefall interrupt threshold.
field.name: FFTH

field.doc: Freefall interrupt counter.
field.name: FFC

register.doc: Freefall interrupt control.
register.name: FFCNTL

field.doc: Free fall engine enable. FFIE = 0 – disable, FFIE = 1 – enable
field.name: FFIE

field.doc: Free fall interrupt latch/un-latch control. ULMODE = 0 – latched, ULMODE = 1 – unlatched
field.name: ULMODE

field.doc: Free fall interrupt delayed clear duration for unlatched mode
field.name: FFDC

field.doc: Debounce methodology control. DCRM = 0 – count up/down, DCRM = 1 – count up/reset
field.name: DCRM

field.doc: Free fall function output data rate
field.name: OFFI

field.doc: Tilt Angle Low Limit: This register sets the low-level threshold for tilt angle detection.
field.name: LL

field.doc: Tilt Angle High Limit: This register sets the high-level threshold for tilt angle detection.
field.name: HL

field.doc: This register sets the Hysteresis that is placed in between the Screen Rotation states.
field.name: HYST

register.doc: Low Power Control
register.name: LP_CNTL1

field.doc: Averaging Filter Control
field.name: AVC

register.doc: Low Power Control 2: The advanced low power control setting reduces the power consumption
register.name: LP_CNTL2

field.doc: Digital power shut-off select
field.name: LPSTPSEL

register.doc: Wake-up engine thresholds.
register.name: WUFTH

field.doc: lsb part of WUF threshold
field.name: WUFTH_L

register.doc: Wake-up/Back-to-sleep engine thresholds.
register.name: BTSWUFTH

field.doc: msb part of BTS threshold
field.name: BTSTH_H

field.doc: msb part of WUF threshold
field.name: WUFTH_H

register.doc: Back-to-sleep engine thresholds.
register.name: BTSTH

field.doc: lsb part of BTS threshold
field.name: BTSTH_L

field.doc: Debounce counter register for the Back-to-Sleep (BTS) engine.
field.name: BTSC

field.doc: Debounce counter register for the Wake-up Function (WUF) engine.
field.name: WUFC

register.doc: Self-Test Enable register:
register.name: SELF_TEST

field.doc: When 0xCA is written to this register, the MEMS self-test function is enabled. Electrostatic-actuation of the accelerometer, results in a DC shift of the X, Y and Z axis outputs
field.name: MEMS_TEST

register.doc: Sample Threshold – determines the number of samples that will trigger a watermark interrupt or will be saved prior to a trigger event. When BRES=1, the maximum number of samples is 86; when BRES=0, the maximum number of samples is 171. The minimum number of samples must be greater than or equal to 2.
register.name: BUF_CNTL1

field.doc: sample threshold level
field.name: SMP_TH

register.doc: Read/write control register that controls sample buffer operation
register.name: BUF_CNTL2

field.doc: controls activation of the sample buffer. BUFE = 0 – sample buffer inactive, BUFE = 1 – sample buffer active
field.name: BUFE

field.doc: determines the resolution of the acceleration data samples collected by the sample buffer. BRES = 0 – 8-bit samples are accumulated in the buffer, BRES = 1 – 16-bit samples are accumulated in the buffer
field.name: BRES

field.doc: buffer full interrupt enable bit. BFIE = 0 – buffer full interrupt is disabled, BFIE = 1 – buffer full interrupt is enabled and updated in INS2
field.name: BFIE

field.doc: selects the operating mode of the sample buffer
field.name: BM

item.doc: The buffer collects 681 sets of 8-bit low resolution values or 339 sets of 16-bit high resolution values and then stops collecting data, collecting new data only when the buffer is not full
item.name: FIFO

item.doc: The buffer holds the last 681 sets of 8-bit low resolution values or 339 sets of 16-bit high resolution values. Once the buffer is full, the oldest data is discarded to make room for newer data.
item.name: STREAM

item.doc: When a trigger event occurs, the buffer holds the last data set of SMP[9:0] samples before the trigger event and then continues to collect data until full. New data is collected only when the buffer is not full.
item.name: TRIGGER

register.doc: These register reports the status of the sample buffer. Note that BUF_STATUS_1 and BUF_STATUS_2 registers may have a delay of up to 1μsec to update the sample level after a buffer read.
register.name: BUF_STATUS_1

field.doc: buffer level lsb bits (7-0)
field.name: SMP_LEV

register.doc: This register reports the status of the sample buffer trigger function
register.name: BUF_STATUS_2

field.doc: reports the status of the buffer’s trigger function if this mode has been selected
field.name: BUF_TRIG

field.doc: buffer level msb bits (9-8)
field.name: SMP_LEV_H

field.doc: Latched buffer status information and the entire sample buffer are cleared when any data is written to this register
Buffer output register

register.doc: Advanced Data Path (ADP) Output Control register 1.
register.name: ADP_CNTL1

field.doc: Number of samples used to calculate RMS output. Each sample is determined by the Advanced Data Path ODR as set by OADP<3:0> bits.
field.name: RMS_AVC

field.doc: Output Data Rate (ODR) for Advanced Data Path.
field.name: OADP

register.doc: Advanced Data Path (ADP) Control register 2.
register.name: ADP_CNTL2

field.doc: Select data to be routed to the sample buffer
field.name: ADP_BUF_SEL

field.doc: Input select for the Wake-up/Back-to-Sleep engines
field.name: ADP_WB_ISEL

field.doc: Select data out to the WUF/BTS engines.
field.name: RMS_WB_OSEL

field.doc: Advanced Data Path Filter-2 bypass control
field.name: ADP_FLT2_BYP

field.doc: Advanced Data Path Filter-1 bypass control
field.name: ADP_FLT1_BYP

field.doc: Select data out to XADP, YADP, and ZADP registers.
field.name: ADP_RMS_OSEL

field.doc: Filter-2 High-pass enable. 0 – Filter-2 is set to Low-pass filter. 1 – Filter-2 is set to High-pass filter
field.name: ADP_F2_HP

register.doc: Advanced Data Path (ADP) Control register 3.
register.name: ADP_CNTL3

field.doc: ADP filter-1 coefficient (1/A)
field.name: ADP_F1_1A

register.doc: Advanced Data Path (ADP) Control registers 4, 5 and 6.
register.name: ADP_CNTL4

field.doc: Advanced Data Path (ADP) Control registers 4, 5 and 6.
field.name: ADP_F1_BA

field.doc: Advanced Data Path (ADP) Control registers 4, 5 and 6.
Advanced Data Path (ADP) Control registers 4, 5 and 6.

register.doc: Advanced Data Path (ADP) Control registers 7, 8 and 9.
register.name: ADP_CNTL7

field.doc: Advanced Data Path (ADP) Control registers 7, 8 and 9.
field.name: ADP_F1_CA

field.doc: Advanced Data Path (ADP) Control registers 7, 8 and 9.
Advanced Data Path (ADP) Control registers 7, 8 and 9.

register.doc: Advanced Data Path (ADP) Control register 10.
register.name: ADP_CNTL10

field.doc: ADP filter-1 input scale shift value
field.name: ADP_F1_ISH

register.doc: Advanced Data Path (ADP) Control register 11.
register.name: ADP_CNTL11

field.doc: ADP filter-1 output scale shift value
field.name: ADP_F1_OSH

field.doc: ADP filter-2 coefficient (1/A)
field.name: ADP_F2_1A

register.doc: Advanced Data Path (ADP) Control registers 12 and 13.
register.name: ADP_CNTL12

field.doc: ADP filter-2 coefficient (B/A)
field.name: ADP_F2_BA

field.doc: ADP Output Control register 13
ADP Output Control register 14
ADP Output Control register 15
ADP Output Control register 16
ADP Output Control register 17

register.doc: ADP Output Control register 18.
register.name: ADP_CNTL18

field.doc: ADP filter-2 input scale shift value
field.name: ADP_F2_ISH

register.doc: ADP Output Control register 19.
register.name: ADP_CNTL19

field.doc: ADP filter-2 output scale shift value
field.name: ADP_F2_OSH
